snippet: A Rwandan genocide survivor’s story reminds us that simple narratives of good and evil, tribulation and triumph rarely capture the way life really is.
abstract: David Brooks Op-Ed column praises essay by Clemantine Wamariya and Elizabeth Weil, published in online magazine Matter, for way it describes complex aftermath of Wamariya's survival of genocide in Rwanda and ultimate reunion with her long-lost family; suggests writing, and public airing, of such a complex and painful story took the same remarkable courage that was required to survive genocide itself.
lead_paragraph: A Rwandan genocide survivor’s story reminds us that simple narratives of good and evil, tribulation and triumph rarely capture the way life really is.
